title: 1999–2000 Toto Cup Al
text:
The 1999–2000 <a href="Toto%20Cup">Toto Cup</a> Al was the 16th season of the third-most important <a href="Association%20football">football</a> tournament in <a href="Israel">Israel</a> since its introduction. This was the first edition to be played with both <a href="1999%E2%80%932000%20Israeli%20Premier%20League">Israeli Premier League</a> and <a href="1999%E2%80%932000%20Liga%20Leumit">Liga Leumit</a> clubs.
The competition began on 6 August 1999 and ended on 15 February 2000, with <a href="Maccabi%20Petah%20Tikva%20F.C.">Maccabi Petah Tikva</a> beating <a href="Maccabi%20Haifa%20F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a> 4–1 in the final.
Format change.
Starting with this edition, the competition was played as a <a href="Single-elimination%20tournament">knock-out tournament</a>, with the first two rounds played <a href="Two-legged%20tie">over two legs</a>, with ties from the quarter-finals and on were decided in a single match.
